message.content: Change this to show the whole hash plan

summary: Nx Hash Plan Inspector: Debugging Task Caching

content.text: I'll help you modify the hash plan display to show the complete hash plan. Let me first examine the current code to understand how it's implemented.
Now let me look at the test file to understand how the hash plan inspection is currently being used:
I can see that the current implementation only shows a summary with the number of files and first few examples. Let me modify the test script to show the complete hash plan with all files:

lines: -          // Show a summary of what files/inputs affect this task's hash
+          // Show the complete hash plan with all files
-            // Show first few files as examples
+            // Show ALL files in the hash plan

content.text:
Now the hash plan inspector will display all files that affect the task hash instead of just showing a summary. The script will now show the complete hash plan, making it easier to understand exactly which files are being tracked for hash calculation.

To test this change, you can run:

```bash
node test-hash-inspector.js
```

The output will now include every file that affects the hash calculation for each target, giving you a complete view of the hash plan.
